fields.summary: iOS build selects invalid simulator when building with watch app

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When running an Apple Watch App on a simulator using {{appc run -p ios}}, a compatible simulator (iPhone) is not launched by default.

*Steps to reproduce issue*
1. Create an Apple Watch App
2. Run the app on a simulator using {{appc run -p ios}}

*Actual Results*
Simulator is an iPad sim, need iPhone

*Expected Results*
A compatible simulator (iPhone) is launched
fields.summary: iOS: Running Watch app doesn't launch compatible simulator
fields.environment:
MacOS 10.11
Studio 4.1.1.201507141126
Ti SDK 4.2.0.v20150728143620
Appc NPM 4.1.0
Appc CLI 4.2.0-1
Ti CLI 4.1.2c
Alloy 1.6.2
Node v0.10.37
Java 1.7.0_45
preproduction
Xcode 7b4

comments.body: It's worth noting that the selection of the iPad simulator was fixed by TIMOB-19265. It still doesn't ensure that the selected iPhone simulator supports watch apps.
